conclusion: To find the magnitude of the Ampere force received by the V-shaped current-carrying wire.
The wire is bent into a V shape with equal side lengths and an included angle of 60 degrees.
Each side of the V shape is of length l.
The effective length of the wire in the direction of the magnetic field is the projection of the wire length onto the direction perpendicular to the magnetic field.
The effective length Leff is the sum of the projections of each side of the V shape onto the direction perpendicular to the magnetic field.
The projection of each side onto the direction perpendicular to the magnetic field is l sin(30 degrees).
The total effective length Leff is 2 * l * sin(30 degrees).
The Ampere force F on a current-carrying wire in a magnetic field is given by F = B I Leff.
Substituting the values, F = B I l.
The magnitude of the Ampere force received by the V-shaped current-carrying wire is B I l.
